_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The practice that's conducive to extingu: Seeing that the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact are not-self
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact is also not-self
Seeing that the ear, sounds, ear consciousness, and ear contact are not-self
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by ear contact is also not-self
Seeing that the nose, smells, nose consciousness, and nose contact are not-self
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by nose contact is also not-self
Seeing that the tongue, tastes, tongue consciousness, and tongue contact are not-self
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by tongue contact is also not-self
Seeing that the body, touches, body consciousness, and body contact are not-self
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by body contact is also not-self
Seeing that the mind, thoughts, mind-consciousness, and mind contact are not-self
Seeing that the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact is also not-self.
